meanings.sent1: She was nulling the contract by tearing it up.
meanings.sent2: The judge nulling the decision due to lack of evidence.
meanings.sent3: The magician nulling the disappearing act by revealing the hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: The storm nulling the picnic plans with heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The eraser nulling the mistake on the paper.

meanings.definition: The act of nullifying or canceling something.
meanings.sent1: The nulling of the agreement caused confusion among the parties involved.
meanings.sent2: His nulling of the appointment led to a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent3: The nulling of the event tickets left many disappointed attendees.
meanings.sent4: The nulling of the membership card meant no more discounts at the store.
meanings.sent5: The nulling of the warranty left the customer without coverage for repairs.
